title: Bug 49299: Inconsistency in URL rewriting when custom cookie name is set
description: Bug 49299Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting
OB:
Created attachment 25442 [details]cookiename.war

In chapter 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is stated that "If a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will also be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session id is encoded in the URL (provided that URL rewriting has been enabled)."

Actual result: The page sends the following cookie:

SetCookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnly

However, the Reload link on the page uses "jsessionid":

http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;jsessionid=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F4.
EB:
Expected result: If the phrase in 7.1.1 is followed, I would expect the Reload link to be:

http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F
SR:
1. Deploy the attached war file (cookiename.war) to a servlet container.
2. Access the application via the specified URL.
3. Look for the "Reload" link on the page.
4. Observe that the "jsessionid" parameter is used instead of the expected custom cookie name.
